resist.special: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: El demonio lanza uno de los siguientes hechizos, que no requieren componentes materiales y utilizan el Carisma como habilidad de lanzamiento (salvación de hechizo {@dc 19}):

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: La oscuridad mágica no impide la visión oscura del diablo.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: El demonio tiene ventaja en las tiradas de salvación contra hechizos y otros efectos mágicos.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: Si el demonio falla una tirada de salvación, puede elegir tener éxito en su lugar.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: El demonio realiza dos ataques de garra y uno de aguijón. También puede utilizar tres veces el Ataque Elemental.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} para golpear, alcance de 10 pies, un objetivo. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) de daño.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} para golpear, alcance de 10 pies, un objetivo. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) de daño punzante más 17 ({@damage 5d6}) de daño por veneno y el objetivo debe tener éxito en una tirada de salvación de Constitución {@dc 14} o quedar {@condition poisoned} durante 1 minuto. El objetivo puede repetir la tirada de salvación al final de cada uno de sus turnos, terminando el efecto sobre sí mismo si tiene éxito.

action.name: Elemental Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 11} para golpear, alcance 120 pies, un objetivo. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) de daño por ácido, frío, fuego o rayo (a elección del diablo).

bonus.name: Quickened Spell (5/Day).
entries: El diablo lanza un hechizo.

reaction.name: Shield (3/Day).
entries: Una barrera de fuerza mágica {@condition invisible} aparece y protege al demonio de los huesos. Hasta el inicio del siguiente turno del demonio de hueso, este tiene un bonificador +5 a la CA, incluso contra el ataque desencadenante, y no recibe daño de los proyectiles mágicos.

legendary.name: Claw
entries: El diablo hace un ataque de garra.

legendary.name: Elemental Bolt
entries: El diablo hace un ataque de Rayo Elemental.

legendary.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: El demonio se teletransporta por arte de magia, junto con cualquier equipo que lleve puesto o que sea portador, hasta 60 pies a un espacio desocupado que pueda ver.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: El diablo lanza un hechizo.

variant.name: Bone Devil Polearm
entries: Algunos diablos de hueso tienen las siguientes opciones de acción.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries: El demonio realiza dos ataques de Arma Enganchada y un ataque de Picadura. Como alternativa, puede usar dos veces Perno Elemental.

entries.name: Hooked Polearm
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} para golpear, alcance de 10 pies, un objetivo. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d12 + 4}) de daño perforante. Si el objetivo es una criatura Huge o más pequeña, es {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Hasta que este agarre termine, el demonio no puede usar su arma de asta en otro objetivo.

Los demonios crecen en poder a medida que ascienden. Suben de rango y se transforman de humildes lemures en diablos menores, luego en diablos mayores y, finalmente, en archidiablos. Sin embargo, en muy raras ocasiones, hay demonios que deciden no transformarse. Demonios que, a través de una fuerza cósmica desconocida o de un poder ajeno, adquieren habilidades más allá de sus límites naturales. Por temor a perder esos poderes después de ser ascendidos, permanecen voluntariamente en su forma actual. Estos demonios pueden seguir subiendo de rango a pesar de estar en una forma inferior. Estos son los casos de los demonios menores y mayores dotados de magia arcana.

entries.name: Arcane Masters
entries: Los magos de los demonios de hueso siguen cumpliendo su papel de capataces. Sin embargo, utilizan la magia para convertirse en los señores definitivos, imponiendo su voluntad a todos los demonios menores, incluidos otros demonios de hueso.

resist.special: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} para golpear, alcance de 10 pies, un objetivo. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) de daño.

action.name: Sting

El objetivo puede repetir la tirada de salvación al final de cada uno de sus turnos, terminando el efecto sobre sí mismo si tiene éxito.

action.name: Elemental Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} para golpear, alcance 120 pies, un objetivo. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) de daño por ácido, frío, fuego o rayo (a elección del diablo).

bonus.name: Quickened Spell (3/Day).

entries.name: Multiattack

Si el objetivo es una criatura Huge o más pequeña, es {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Hasta que este agarre termine, el demonio no puede usar su arma de asta en otro objetivo.

Sin embargo, en muy raras ocasiones, hay demonios que deciden no transformarse. Demonios que, a través de una fuerza cósmica desconocida o de un poder ajeno, adquieren habilidades más allá de sus límites naturales. Por temor a perder esos poderes después de ser ascendidos, permanecen voluntariamente en su forma actual. Estos demonios pueden seguir subiendo de rango a pesar de estar en una forma inferior. Estos son los casos de los demonios menores y mayores dotados de magia arcana.

resist.special: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from   nonmagical attacks

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: El demonio lanza uno de los siguientes hechizos, que no requieren componentes materiales y utilizan el Carisma como habilidad de lanzamiento (salvación de hechizo {@dc 16}):

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: La oscuridad mágica no impide la visión oscura del diablo.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: El demonio tiene ventaja en las tiradas de salvación contra hechizos y otros efectos mágicos.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: El demonio realiza dos ataques de garra y uno de aguijón. Como alternativa, puede usar dos veces el Ataque Elemental.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} para golpear, alcance de 10 pies, un objetivo. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) de daño.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} para golpear, alcance de 10 pies, un objetivo. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) de daño punzante más 17 ({@damage 5d6}) de daño por veneno y el objetivo debe tener éxito en una tirada de salvación de Constitución {@dc 14} o quedar {@condition poisoned} durante 1 minuto. El objetivo puede repetir la tirada de salvación al final de cada uno de sus turnos, terminando el efecto sobre sí mismo si tiene éxito.

action.name: Elemental Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} para golpear, alcance 120 pies, un objetivo. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) de daño por ácido, frío, fuego o rayo (a elección del diablo).

reaction.name: Shield (3/Day).
entries: Una barrera de fuerza mágica {@condition invisible} aparece y protege al demonio de los huesos. Hasta el inicio del siguiente turno del demonio de hueso, este tiene un bonificador +5 a la CA, incluso contra el ataque desencadenante, y no recibe daño de los proyectiles mágicos.

variant.name: Bone Devil Polearm
entries: Algunos diablos de hueso tienen las siguientes opciones de acción.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries: El demonio realiza dos ataques de Arma Enganchada y un ataque de Picadura. Como alternativa, puede usar dos veces Perno Elemental.

entries.name: Hooked Polearm
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} para golpear, alcance de 10 pies, un objetivo. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d12 + 4}) de daño perforante. Si el objetivo es una criatura Huge o más pequeña, es {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Hasta que este agarre termine, el demonio no puede usar su arma de asta en otro objetivo.

Los demonios crecen en poder a medida que ascienden. Suben de rango y se transforman de humildes lemures en diablos menores, luego en diablos mayores y, finalmente, en archidiablos. Sin embargo, en muy raras ocasiones, hay demonios que deciden no transformarse. Demonios que, a través de una fuerza cósmica desconocida o de un poder ajeno, adquieren habilidades más allá de sus límites naturales. Por temor a perder esos poderes después de ser ascendidos, permanecen voluntariamente en su forma actual. Estos demonios pueden seguir subiendo de rango a pesar de estar en una forma inferior. Estos son los casos de los demonios menores y mayores dotados de magia arcana.

entries.name: Arcane Masters
entries: Los magos de los demonios de hueso siguen cumpliendo su papel de capataces. Sin embargo, utilizan la magia para convertirse en los señores definitivos, imponiendo su voluntad a todos los demonios menores, incluidos otros demonios de hueso.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: El mago de la escarcha lanza uno de los siguientes hechizos utilizando la Inteligencia como habilidad de lanzamiento (salvación de hechizos {@dc 14}):

action.name: Frost Strike
entries: {@atk m,rs} {@hit 6} para golpear, alcance de 5 pies o 60 pies, un objetivo. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) de daño por frío y el objetivo no puede tomar reacciones hasta el final del siguiente turno del mago de la escarcha.

action.name: Icy Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: El mago de la escarcha lanza mágicamente carámbanos helados en un cono de 30 pies. Cada criatura que se encuentre en esa área debe realizar una tirada de salvación de Destreza {@dc 14}, recibiendo 14 ({@damage 4d6}) de daño por frío y 14 ({@damage 4d6}) de daño punzante si falla la tirada de salvación, o la mitad de daño si tiene éxito.

Los magos de la escarcha dedican su vida a aprender y obsesionarse con el poder del frío elemental. Buscan desvelar los misterios de la magia de la escarcha y dominar cómo aprovechar y canalizar su energía. Debido a los años de exposición a la magia del frío, los magos de la escarcha desarrollan una resistencia a ella.

En el combate, los magos de la escarcha pueden ser sorprendentemente versátiles a pesar de centrarse en la magia del frío. Pueden proporcionar cobertura cubriendo grandes áreas con niebla y aguanieve, paralizar a la gente con sus hechizos de retención de personas y dañar a múltiples objetivos con su habilidad de ráfaga de hielo y su hechizo de tormenta de hielo.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: El mago de la escarcha lanza uno de los siguientes hechizos utilizando la Inteligencia como habilidad de lanzamiento (salvación de hechizos {@dc 14}):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: El mago de la escarcha usa Golpe de Escarcha dos veces.

action.name: Frost Strike
entries: {@atk m,rs} {@hit 7} para golpear, alcance de 5 pies o 60 pies, un objetivo. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) de daño por frío y el objetivo no puede tomar reacciones hasta el final del siguiente turno del mago de la escarcha.

action.name: Icy Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: El mago de la escarcha dispara mágicamente carámbanos helados en un cono de 30 pies. Cada criatura que se encuentre en esa área debe realizar una tirada de salvación de Destreza {@dc 15}, recibiendo 17 ({@damage 5d6}) de daño por frío y 17 ({@damage 5d6}) de daño punzante si falla la tirada de salvación, o la mitad de daño si tiene éxito.

action.name: Frost Bloom (1/Day)
entries: Un mágico y deslumbrante copo de nieve sale del dedo que señala el mago de la escarcha hacia un punto que pueda ver en un radio de 120 pies y luego florece con un sonido crepitante y sibilante en una explosión de hielo helado. Cada criatura en una esfera de 20 pies de radio centrada en ese punto debe hacer una tirada de salvación de Constitución {@dc 15}. Si falla la tirada de salvación, la criatura recibe 35 ({@damage 10d6}) de daño por frío y queda congelada en el hielo durante 1 minuto. Mientras está congelada, la criatura está {@condition restrained}. Como acción, el {@condition restrained} objetivo puede hacer un chequeo de Fuerza {@dc 15}, rompiendo el hielo si tiene éxito. El hielo también puede ser atacado y destruido (CA 12; hp 15; vulnerabilidad al daño por fuego; inmunidad al frío, al veneno y al daño psíquico). Si la salvación tiene éxito, la criatura recibe la mitad de daño y no queda congelada en el hielo.
El hielo helado se extiende por las esquinas.

reaction.name: Ice Block (3/Day)
entries: El mago de la escarcha puede elegir entre dos efectos mágicos:
1. Escudo. Cuando un atacante golpea al mago de la escarcha con un ataque y el mago de la escarcha puede ver al atacante, el mago de la escarcha puede sumar 4 a su CA contra el ataque desencadenante.

2. Barrera. Cuando el mago de la escarcha está sometido a un efecto que le permite hacer una tirada de salvación de Fuerza o Destreza para recibir sólo la mitad del daño, puede no recibir ningún daño si tiene éxito en la tirada de salvación, y sólo la mitad del daño si falla.

Los magos de la escarcha dedican su vida a aprender y obsesionarse con el poder del frío elemental. Buscan desvelar los misterios de la magia de la escarcha y dominar cómo aprovechar y canalizar su energía. Debido a los años de exposición a la magia del frío, los magos de la escarcha desarrollan una resistencia a ella.

En el combate, los magos de la escarcha pueden ser sorprendentemente versátiles a pesar de centrarse en la magia del frío. Pueden proporcionar cobertura cubriendo grandes áreas con niebla y aguanieve, paralizar a la gente con sus hechizos de retención de personas y dañar a múltiples objetivos con su habilidad de ráfaga de hielo y su hechizo de tormenta de hielo.

monster.name: Frost Mage, Legendary

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: El mago de la escarcha lanza uno de los siguientes hechizos utilizando la Inteligencia como habilidad de lanzamiento (salvación de hechizos {@dc 18}):

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: Si el mago de la escarcha falla una tirada de salvación, puede elegir tener éxito en su lugar.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: El mago de la escarcha usa Golpe de Escarcha tres veces.

action.name: Frost Strike
entries: {@atk m,rs} {@hit 10} para golpear, alcance de 5 pies o 60 pies, un objetivo. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) de daño por frío y el objetivo no puede tomar reacciones hasta el final del siguiente turno del mago de la escarcha.

action.name: Icy Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: El mago de la escarcha dispara mágicamente carámbanos helados en un cono de 30 pies. Cada criatura que se encuentre en esa área debe realizar una tirada de salvación de Destreza {@dc 18}, recibiendo 21 ({@damage 6d6}) de daño por frío y 21 ({@damage 6d6}) de daño punzante si falla la tirada de salvación, o la mitad de daño si tiene éxito.

action.name: Frost Bloom (1/Day)
entries: Un mágico y deslumbrante copo de nieve sale del dedo que señala el mago de la escarcha hacia un punto que pueda ver en un radio de 120 pies y luego florece con un sonido crepitante y sibilante en una explosión de hielo helado. Cada criatura en una esfera de 20 pies de radio centrada en ese punto debe hacer una tirada de salvación de Constitución {@dc 18}. Si falla la tirada de salvación, la criatura recibe 42 ({@damage 12d6}) de daño por frío y queda congelada en el hielo durante 1 minuto. Mientras está congelada, la criatura está {@condition restrained}. Como acción, el {@condition restrained} objetivo puede hacer un chequeo de Fuerza {@dc 18}, rompiendo el hielo si tiene éxito. El hielo también puede ser atacado y destruido (CA 12; hp 15; vulnerabilidad al daño por fuego; inmunidad al frío, al veneno y al daño psíquico). Si la salvación tiene éxito, la criatura recibe la mitad de daño y no queda congelada en el hielo.
El hielo helado se extiende por las esquinas.

reaction.name: Ice Block (5/Day)
entries: El mago de la escarcha puede elegir entre dos efectos mágicos:

1. Escudo. Cuando un atacante golpea al mago de la escarcha con un ataque y el mago de la escarcha puede ver al atacante, el mago de la escarcha puede añadir 5 a su CA contra el ataque desencadenante.

2. Barrera. Cuando el mago de la escarcha está sometido a un efecto que le permite hacer una tirada de salvación de Fuerza o Destreza para recibir sólo la mitad del daño, puede no recibir ningún daño si tiene éxito en la tirada de salvación, y sólo la mitad del daño si falla.

legendaryHeader: The frost mage can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The frost mage regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Ice Slide
entries: El mago de la escarcha se mueve hasta la mitad de su velocidad sin provocar ataques de oportunidad.

legendary.name: Frost Strike
entries: El mago de la escarcha usa Golpe de Escarcha.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: El mago de la escarcha lanza un hechizo.

Los magos de la escarcha dedican su vida a aprender y obsesionarse con el poder del frío elemental. Buscan desvelar los misterios de la magia de la escarcha y dominar cómo aprovechar y canalizar su energía. Debido a los años de exposición a la magia del frío, los magos de la escarcha desarrollan una resistencia a ella.

En el combate, los magos de la escarcha pueden ser sorprendentemente versátiles a pesar de centrarse en la magia del frío. Pueden proporcionar cobertura cubriendo grandes áreas con niebla y aguanieve, paralizar a la gente con sus hechizos de retención de personas y dañar a múltiples objetivos con su habilidad de ráfaga de hielo y su hechizo de tormenta de hielo.

entries.name: A Legendary Frost Mage's Lair
entries: A Legendary Frost Mage's Lair Legendary frost mages typically live in keeps and towers, often built from ice, in desolate and uninviting places that are perpetually shrouded by the cold such as glaciers and tundras. A legendary frost mage encountered in its lair has a challenge rating of 14 (11,500 XP).

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Demogorgon can take one of the following lair actions; he can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:

items.name: Freezing Mist
entries: The legendary frost mage casts {@spell fog cloud} requiring no material components.

items.name: Seeping Rime
entries: The legendary frost mage targets one creature it can see within 120 feet of it. The target is struck by a magical, numbing cold. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage and its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of the legendary frost mage's turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage with no additional effects.

items.name: Glacial Field
entries: The ground in a 20-foot radius centered on a point within 120 feet of the frost mage instantaneously erupts with jagged ice and frost. The area becomes difficult terrain for the duration. When a creature moves into or within the area, it takes ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage and ({@damage 1d4}) cold damage for every 5 feet it travels. The jagged ice and frost disappears when the legendary frost mage uses this lair action again or when the legendary frost mage dies or is incapacitated.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell.
entries: The grendol has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing and smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The grendol regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn. If the grendol takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the grendol's next turn. The grendol dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Sensitive Hearing
entries: The grendol has disadvantage on saving throws made against being {@condition deafened}.

action.name: Multiattack.
entries: The grendol makes two melee attacks. If the grendol is grappling a creature, the grendol can also make one Bite attack.

action.name: Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the grendol can automatically hit the target with its Slam attack, can't attack another target with one of its Slam attacks, and can't make Greatclub attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

Grendols are loathsome, hulking giants closely related to ogres and trolls. They stand between 10 and 11 feet tall and weigh a thousand pounds. They often have mishapen heads, bulbuous noses, and tusks growing from their oversized jaws.

entries.name: Bitter Brutes
entries: Like ogres, grendols are illtempered, greedy, and stupid. They hate and envy civilized folk and resent the joy and happiness they show during their festivities. Due to their very sensitive hearing, they particularly detest the music and noise from such celebrations. Even when grendols are a mile away, such sounds are strong enough to drive them into a murderous frenzy.

entries.name: Savage Tormentors
entries: Grendols are cruel bullies who love nothing more than grab intelligent folk, tear their limbs apart, and laugh at their screams before devouring them alive. While grendols would eat anything, they prefer the taste of human, dwarf, elf, and halfling flesh.

entries.name: Monstrous Kin
entries: Grendols live a nomadic lifestyle and typically make camp in caves, ruins, thick forests, hills, mountains, and swamps. They usually keep the same company but they can also be found living with ogres, ettins, trolls, and hill giants. Grendols fear and revere hags, serving them as loyal minions. It is said that grendols are the spawns of hags after mating with a humanoid but it has not been substantiated.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell.
entries: The grendol has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing and smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The grendol regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn. If the grendol takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the grendol's next turn. The grendol dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Sensitive Hearing
entries: The grendol has disadvantage on saving throws made against being {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the grendol can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack.
entries: The grendol uses War Cry. It then makes two melee attacks. If the grendol is grappling a creature, the grendol can also make one Bite attack.

action.name: Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the grendol can automatically hit the target with its Slam attack, can't attack another target with one of its Slam attacks, and can't make Greatclub attacks.

action.name: Fling
entries: One object held or creature that is smaller than the grendol and is {@condition grappled} by the grendol is thrown up to 30 feet towards a target space and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown creature strikes a solid surface, the creature takes 5 bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the creature is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes the same damage and is knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: War Cry (Recharge 5–6).
entries: The grendol emits a terrifying battle cry. Each enemy creature within 30 feet of the grendol that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the grendol for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this grendol's War Cry for the next 24 hours.

Grendols are loathsome, hulking giants closely related to ogres and trolls. They stand between 10 and 11 feet tall and weigh a thousand pounds. They often have mishapen heads, bulbuous noses, and tusks growing from their oversized jaws.

entries.name: Bitter Brutes
entries: Like ogres, grendols are illtempered, greedy, and stupid. They hate and envy civilized folk and resent the joy and happiness they show during their festivities. Due to their very sensitive hearing, they particularly detest the music and noise from such celebrations. Even when grendols are a mile away, such sounds are strong enough to drive them into a murderous frenzy.

entries.name: Savage Tormentors
entries: Grendols are cruel bullies who love nothing more than grab intelligent folk, tear their limbs apart, and laugh at their screams before devouring them alive. While grendols would eat anything, they prefer the taste of human, dwarf, elf, and halfling flesh.

entries.name: Monstrous Kin
entries: Grendols live a nomadic lifestyle and typically make camp in caves, ruins, thick forests, hills, mountains, and swamps. They usually keep the same company but they can also be found living with ogres, ettins, trolls, and hill giants. Grendols fear and revere hags, serving them as loyal minions. It is said that grendols are the spawns of hags after mating with a humanoid but it has not been substantiated.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell.
entries: The grendol has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing and smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The grendol regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn. If the grendol takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the grendol's next turn. The grendol dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Sensitive Hearing
entries: The grendol has disadvantage on saving throws made against being {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the grendol can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the grendol fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack.
entries: The grendol makes two melee attacks. If the grendol is grappling a creature, the grendol can also make one Bite attack.

action.name: Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the grendol can automatically hit the target with its Slam attack, can't attack another target with one of its Slam attacks, and can't make Greatclub attacks.

action.name: Fling
entries: One object held or creature that is smaller than the grendol and is {@condition grappled} by the grendol is thrown up to 30 feet towards a target space and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown creature strikes a solid surface, the creature takes 5 bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the creature is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes the same damage and is knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

legendary.name: Charge
entries: The grendol moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Batter
entries: The grendol makes a Slam attack or uses Fling

legendary.name: Wallop (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of of the grendol's next turn. If the target fails its saving throw by 5 or more, it is knocked {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. The {@condition unconscious} target repeats the saving throw if it takes damage and at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success

Grendols are loathsome, hulking giants closely related to ogres and trolls. They stand between 10 and 11 feet tall and weigh a thousand pounds. They often have mishapen heads, bulbuous noses, and tusks growing from their oversized jaws.

entries.name: Bitter Brutes
entries: Like ogres, grendols are illtempered, greedy, and stupid. They hate and envy civilized folk and resent the joy and happiness they show during their festivities. Due to their very sensitive hearing, they particularly detest the music and noise from such celebrations. Even when grendols are a mile away, such sounds are strong enough to drive them into a murderous frenzy.

entries.name: Savage Tormentors
entries: Grendols are cruel bullies who love nothing more than grab intelligent folk, tear their limbs apart, and laugh at their screams before devouring them alive. While grendols would eat anything, they prefer the taste of human, dwarf, elf, and halfling flesh.

entries.name: Monstrous Kin
entries: Grendols live a nomadic lifestyle and typically make camp in caves, ruins, thick forests, hills, mountains, and swamps. They usually keep the same company but they can also be found living with ogres, ettins, trolls, and hill giants. Grendols fear and revere hags, serving them as loyal minions. It is said that grendols are the spawns of hags after mating with a humanoid but it has not been substantiated.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the maul brute hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the maul brute can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the maul brute is wearing no armor, its AC includes its Constitution modifier

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Sunder
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and if the target is wearing a nonmagical armor or shield, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or the Armor Class (AC) of the nonmagical armor or shield (determined randomly) of the target takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty. If its Armor Class drops to 0, the nonmagical armor or shield is destroyed.

The maul brute is a hulking and savage warrior who wields a massive maul. It rarely wears any armor, opting to fight bare-chested to show its horrifying scarred skin and make itself more mobile. When the maul brute approaches, the heavy thumps its iron boots make can be heard.

During combat, the maul brute charges recklessly toward its foes with no concern about getting hit. It believes it can finish its foes quickly before they can deal any real injury to it. The maul brute can crush the skulls of its enemies with a single strike of its weapon and batter their armor and shields, rendering them useless.
A maul brute is often encountered as a bodyguard, a guardian, a gladiator champion, or a warden of a dungeon.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the maul brute hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the maul brute can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the maul brute is wearing no armor, its AC includes its Constitution modifier

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The maul crusher makes two melee attacks

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Sunder
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and if the target is wearing a nonmagical armor or shield, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or the Armor Class (AC) of the nonmagical armor or shield (determined randomly) of the target takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty. If its Armor Class drops to 0, the nonmagical armor or shield is destroyed.

action.name: Staggering Blow {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 6d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks, can't take reactions, and its speed is reduced to 10 feet for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the effects on itself on a success.

The maul brute is a hulking and savage warrior who wields a massive maul. It rarely wears any armor, opting to fight bare-chested to show its horrifying scarred skin and make itself more mobile. When the maul brute approaches, the heavy thumps its iron boots make can be heard.

During combat, the maul brute charges recklessly toward its foes with no concern about getting hit. It believes it can finish its foes quickly before they can deal any real injury to it. The maul brute can crush the skulls of its enemies with a single strike of its weapon and batter their armor and shields, rendering them useless.
A maul brute is often encountered as a bodyguard, a guardian, a gladiator champion, or a warden of a dungeon.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the maul brute hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the maul brute can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the maul brute is wearing no armor, its AC includes its Constitution modifier

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the maul juggernaut fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Overpowering Charge
entries: If the maul juggernaut moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Maul attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be pushed horizontally up to 5 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}. If the target's saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The maul crusher makes two melee attacks

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and the target has disadvantage on the next weapon attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

action.name: Sunder
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and if the target is wearing a nonmagical armor or shield, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or the Armor Class (AC) of the nonmagical armor or shield (determined randomly) of the target takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty. If its Armor Class drops to 0, the nonmagical armor or shield is destroyed.

action.name: Staggering Blow {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}33 ({@damage 8d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks, can't take reactions, and its speed is reduced to 10 feet for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the effects on itself on a success.

legendary.name: Charge
entries: The maul juggernaut moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Intimidate Foe
entries: The maul juggernaut targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the maul juggernaut, it must make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of the maul juggernaut until the end of the maul juggernaut's next turn.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The maul juggernaut makes a Maul or Sunder attack.

The maul brute is a hulking and savage warrior who wields a massive maul. It rarely wears any armor, opting to fight bare-chested to show its horrifying scarred skin and make itself more mobile. When the maul brute approaches, the heavy thumps its iron boots make can be heard.

During combat, the maul brute charges recklessly toward its foes with no concern about getting hit. It believes it can finish its foes quickly before they can deal any real injury to it. The maul brute can crush the skulls of its enemies with a single strike of its weapon and batter their armor and shields, rendering them useless.
A maul brute is often encountered as a bodyguard, a guardian, a gladiator champion, or a warden of a dungeon.

trait.name: Tail Spike Regrowth
entries: The scorpicore has twenty-four tail spikes. Used spikes regrow when the manticore finishes a long rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The scorpicore makes three attacks: one with its Bite, one with its Claws, and one with its Sting. Alternatively, it can make three Tail Spike attacks

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage and the target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Tail Spike
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 100/200 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage, plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) poison damage.

A scorpicore is a rare species of manticore that lives in arid deserts, desolate badlands, and hot-climate wastelands. Like a typical manticore, it has a feral-looking humanoid head, the body and tail of a lion, and the wings of a dragon. Where it differs is with its tail, which resembles that of a scorpion. Aside from using it to sting prey, the scorpicore can also launch venomous spikes like a manticore.

entries.name: Deadly Mates
entries: Scorpicores are usually solitary and are less sociable than their manticore cousins. Females are typically larger than males and only keep the company of their young unless it is mating season. Male scorpicores search for mates and offer gifts in the form of captured prey and treasure. If the offer is accepted, male scorpicores get to mate with the female. However, female scorpicores often kill the males after mating by injecting them with a series of lethal stings, after which the female devours them.

entries.name: Monstrous Mercenaries
entries: Scorpicores rarely keep the company of other creatures. They hate and are highly suspicious of other creatures and only see them as prey. However, if offered a steady supply of food and treasure, scorpicores can be hired as mercenaries by more formidable creatures such as lamias and sphinxes.

trait.name: Tail Spike Regrowth
entries: The scorpicore has twenty-four tail spikes. Used spikes regrow when the manticore finishes a long rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The scorpicore uses its Roar. It then makes three attacks: one with its Bite, one with its Claws, and one with its Sting. If Roar is available, it can use Roar in place of its Bite attack. Alternatively, it can make three Tail Spike attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 5d10}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Tail Spike
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 100/200 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Roar {@recharge 5}
entries: The scorpicore emits a loud, intimidating roar audible out to 120 feet. Each allied creature within 60 feet of the scorpicore that can hear it gain advantage to saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. Each enemy creature within 60 feet of the scorpicore that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the scorpicore for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this scorpicore's Roar for the next 24 hours.

A scorpicore is a rare species of manticore that lives in arid deserts, desolate badlands, and hot-climate wastelands. Like a typical manticore, it has a feral-looking humanoid head, the body and tail of a lion, and the wings of a dragon. Where it differs is with its tail, which resembles that of a scorpion. Aside from using it to sting prey, the scorpicore can also launch venomous spikes like a manticore.

entries.name: Deadly Mates
entries: Scorpicores are usually solitary and are less sociable than their manticore cousins. Females are typically larger than males and only keep the company of their young unless it is mating season. Male scorpicores search for mates and offer gifts in the form of captured prey and treasure. If the offer is accepted, male scorpicores get to mate with the female. However, female scorpicores often kill the males after mating by injecting them with a series of lethal stings, after which the female devours them.

entries.name: Monstrous Mercenaries
entries: Scorpicores rarely keep the company of other creatures. They hate and are highly suspicious of other creatures and only see them as prey. However, if offered a steady supply of food and treasure, scorpicores can be hired as mercenaries by more formidable creatures such as lamias and sphinxes.

trait.name: Tail Spike Regrowth
entries: The scorpicore has twenty-four tail spikes. Used spikes regrow when the manticore finishes a long rest.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the scorpicore, legendary fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The scorpicore makes one Bite attack, two Claw attacks, and one Sting attack. If Roar is available, it can use Roar in place of its Bite attack. Alternatively, it can make three Tail Spike attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Tail Spike
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 100/200 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Roar {@recharge 5}
entries: The scorpicore emits a loud, intimidating roar audible out to 120 feet. Each allied creature within 60 feet of the scorpicore that can hear it gain advantage to saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. Each enemy creature within 60 feet of the scorpicore that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the scorpicore for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this scorpicore's Roar for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Claw
entries: The scorpicore makes one Claw attack

legendary.name: Spike (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The scorpicore makes one Tail Spike attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The scorpicore beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the scorpicore must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take 12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The scorpicore can then fly up to half its flying speed.

A scorpicore is a rare species of manticore that lives in arid deserts, desolate badlands, and hot-climate wastelands. Like a typical manticore, it has a feral-looking humanoid head, the body and tail of a lion, and the wings of a dragon. Where it differs is with its tail, which resembles that of a scorpion. Aside from using it to sting prey, the scorpicore can also launch venomous spikes like a manticore.

entries.name: Deadly Mates
entries: Scorpicores are usually solitary and are less sociable than their manticore cousins. Females are typically larger than males and only keep the company of their young unless it is mating season. Male scorpicores search for mates and offer gifts in the form of captured prey and treasure. If the offer is accepted, male scorpicores get to mate with the female. However, female scorpicores often kill the males after mating by injecting them with a series of lethal stings, after which the female devours them.

entries.name: Monstrous Mercenaries
entries: Scorpicores rarely keep the company of other creatures. They hate and are highly suspicious of other creatures and only see them as prey. However, if offered a steady supply of food and treasure, scorpicores can be hired as mercenaries by more formidable creatures such as lamias and sphinxes.

entries.name: A Legendary Scorpicore's Lair
entries: A legendary scorpicore makes its lair in hidden caves and forgotten ruins half-buried by the desert sands.

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the scorpicore can take a lair action to cause one of the following magical effects; the scorpicore can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items.name: Stinging Sands
entries: The scorpicore violently beats its wings, launching and showering sand to everyone around it. Each creature within 20 feet of the scorpicore must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end the of the scorpicore's next turn.

items.name: Pinning Spike
entries: The scorpicore makes one Tail Spike attack. If it hits, the creature must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be impaled. An impaled creature is restrained until it or another creature spends an action to remove the spike.

items.name: Rapid Regrowth
entries: The scorpicore regrows 4 tail spikes

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The tarasca can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tarasca makes two attacks: one with its Bite and one with its Sting. It can't make both attacks against the same target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the tarasca can automatically hit the target with its Bite attack, and the tarasca can't attack another target with its Bite attack.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.  The target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Poison Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The tarasca exhales poisonous fumes in a 15-foot cube. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A {@condition poisoned} creature is {@condition incapacitated}. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}. A creature being {@condition grappled} by the tarasca has disadvantage on the saving throw

At first glance, the monstrous tarasca appears to be a cross between a lion, a bear, and a turtle. The tarasca (not to be confused with the tarrasque) has the head of a lion, six legs of a bear, a turtle's shell, and a tail that ends with a deadly stinger. Its mouth is beaked like a turtle's and ridged like a jagged saw. Sharp bony spikes line the top and sides of its hard shell.

entries.name: Dangerous Adversary
entries: The dreaded tarasca is fiercely territorial and is known for its aggression and irascibility. It fears little and will even attack creatures bigger than itself. Most predators, even dragons, stay clear of it and find the tarasca simply not worth the risk of having a grievous injury. Aside from its stinger that can inject deadly venom, the tarasca can also exhale a highly toxic gas. Victims who survived getting caught by the breath describe the experience as having unbearably excruciating pain as if their insides are getting burned.

entries.name: Amphibious Predator
entries: The tarasca is an amphibious creature that lives in flooded caves and underground caverns near large bodies of water such as coasts, coves, lakes, swamps, and rivers. It will eat and hunt anything of its size and smaller but prefers large fish and reptiles. It has been known to attack and pick off occupants of boats and even lunge from underwater to snap at a passing horse or livestock before dragging it back to the water.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The tarasca can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the tarasca, ancient fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tarasca makes one Bite attack, two Claw attacks, and one Sting attack. It can't use its Bite and Sting attacks against the same target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) piercing damage, plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}). Until this grapple ends, the tarasca can automatically hit the target with its Bite attack, and the tarasca can't attack another target with its Bite attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) piercing damage.  The target must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The tarasca makes a Bite attack against a Medium or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the tarasca, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the tarasca's turns.

The tarasca can have only one creature swallowed at a time. If the tarasca takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the tarasca must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the swallowed creature, which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 5 feet of the tarasca. If the tarasca dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 5 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Poison Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The tarasca exhales poisonous fumes in a 60-foot cube. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 49 ({@damage 14d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A {@condition poisoned} creature is {@condition incapacitated}. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}. A creature being {@condition grappled} by the tarasca has disadvantage on the saving throw

legendary.name: Crawl
entries: The tarasca moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Claw
entries: The tarasca makes a Claw attack.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The tarasca makes a Bite attack or uses Swallow.

At first glance, the monstrous tarasca appears to be a cross between a lion, a bear, and a turtle. The tarasca (not to be confused with the tarrasque) has the head of a lion, six legs of a bear, a turtle's shell, and a tail that ends with a deadly stinger. Its mouth is beaked like a turtle's and ridged like a jagged saw. Sharp bony spikes line the top and sides of its hard shell.

entries.name: Dangerous Adversary
entries: The dreaded tarasca is fiercely territorial and is known for its aggression and irascibility. It fears little and will even attack creatures bigger than itself. Most predators, even dragons, stay clear of it and find the tarasca simply not worth the risk of having a grievous injury. Aside from its stinger that can inject deadly venom, the tarasca can also exhale a highly toxic gas. Victims who survived getting caught by the breath describe the experience as having unbearably excruciating pain as if their insides are getting burned.

entries.name: Amphibious Predator
entries: The tarasca is an amphibious creature that lives in flooded caves and underground caverns near large bodies of water such as coasts, coves, lakes, swamps, and rivers. It will eat and hunt anything of its size and smaller but prefers large fish and reptiles. It has been known to attack and pick off occupants of boats and even lunge from underwater to snap at a passing horse or livestock before dragging it back to the water.

entries.name: An  Ancient Tarasca's Lair
entries: An ancient tarasca lives in large cavern complexes accessible only via a large underwater tunnel or passage.

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the tarasca can take a lair action to cause one of the following magical effects; the tarasca can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items.name: Ancients Bellow
entries: The tarasca emits a loud roar. Each enemy creature within 120 feet of the tarasca that can hear it must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of the tarasca's next turn.

items.name: Pinning Spike
entries: The tarasca causes the ground near it to shake violently. Each creature standing on the ground within 60 feet of the tarasca must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

items.name: Swift Recovery
entries: The tarasca regains 30 hit points.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The tarasca can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tarasca makes two attacks: one with its Bite and one with its Sting. It can't make both attacks against the same target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) piercing damage, plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until this grapple ends, the tarasca can automatically hit the target with its Bite attack, and the tarasca can't attack another target with its Bite attack.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage.  The target must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 24 ({@damage 7d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The tarasca makes a Bite attack against a Medium or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the tarasca, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the tarasca's turns.

The tarasca can have only one creature swallowed at a time. If the tarasca takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the tarasca must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the swallowed creature, which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 5 feet of the tarasca. If the tarasca dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 5 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Poison Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The tarasca exhales poisonous fumes in a 30-foot cube. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A {@condition poisoned} creature is {@condition incapacitated}. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}. A creature being {@condition grappled} by the tarasca has disadvantage on the saving throw

At first glance, the monstrous tarasca appears to be a cross between a lion, a bear, and a turtle. The tarasca (not to be confused with the tarrasque) has the head of a lion, six legs of a bear, a turtle's shell, and a tail that ends with a deadly stinger. Its mouth is beaked like a turtle's and ridged like a jagged saw. Sharp bony spikes line the top and sides of its hard shell.

entries: The dreaded tarasca is fiercely territorial and is known for its aggression and irascibility. It fears little and will even attack creatures bigger than itself. Most predators, even dragons, stay clear of it and find the tarasca simply not worth the risk of having a grievous injury. Aside from its stinger that can inject deadly venom, the tarasca can also exhale a highly toxic gas. Victims who survived getting caught by the breath describe the experience as having unbearably excruciating pain as if their insides are getting burned.

entries: The tarasca is an amphibious creature that lives in flooded caves and underground caverns near large bodies of water such as coasts, coves, lakes, swamps, and rivers. It will eat and hunt anything of its size and smaller but prefers large fish and reptiles. It has been known to attack and pick off occupants of boats and even lunge from underwater to snap at a passing horse or livestock before dragging it back to the water.
